Key Match Events: Tanzim Sakib picked 3 wickets in the powerplay, rattling the South African top-order.
Pre-Game Insights: Close to 25,000 fans filled the stands in New York for Monday's game.
Bangladesh had a strong support for their Group D game against South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: Tanzim Sakib said: 'Always happy to see the crowd, really appreciate it. And their support is really motivating for us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stands, barring the premium ones, were packed to the rafters for their Group D game against South Africa.
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller stitched a 79-run stand for the 5th wicket -- a record for South Africa in men's T20 World Cup 2024.
